website_summaries.verdict: One of the most authentic folding shovels and entrenching tools available straight from the military.
pros: Combination steel and aluminum construction is lightweight and durable
Serrated shovel edge allows you to cut through small obstacles or brush when outside
cons: The folding mechanism can seize up, making it difficult to fold or unfold quickly

customer_reviews.title: These sellers are trying to fool people who don't k ow what a real GI military shovel looks like.
customer_reviews.text: The one I received is not Military Original, it is fake. Green coated paint and poorly painted as well. Handle not as described and not the weigjt it advertises. These sellers are trying to fool people who don't k ow what a real GI military shovel looks like.
customer_reviews.author: Mannyo

customer_reviews.title: FAKE ITEM: This shovel wont shovel schitt.
customer_reviews.text: CAUTION: on 6.30.17- FAKE item received. This shovel as advertised "US GI Military Original Issue E-Tool Entrenching shovel" arrived in a low grade-cheap nylon sack(not listed in ad) as labeled TEKTON 3-WAY FOLDING SHOVEL. As labeled- "Made in China for Michigan Industrial Tools Grand Rapids, MI 49548. mit-tool.com. This FAKE and FAUX shovel has a steel handle(magnet test-fail). Green glossy paint. Painted over dull stamped serrated/saw edges. AS ADVERTISED to be Aluminum handle-Black powder coat finish-sharpened edges. Also, this FAKE and FAUX shovel folds up sloppy and mis-aligned with unpainted generic bolt and washer loosely securing shovel to blade. Photos to follow.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Fake Clone -Don't get cheated like me
customer_reviews.text: It is not a USGI Shovel. The one I got came in a flimsy nylon pouch and the label says "Fruiteam." False advertising. Feel cheated.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Cheap misleading copy
customer_reviews.text: The first photo is original G I issue, mine personally. The pic on the right is cheap copy. It is misleading as original issue. The 3rd pic shows the rivet, the cheap copy has a nut and bolt. the cutting /chopping edges on the original is sharp and defined, the copy is rounded over. When the knob is tightened on the copy, it is still really sloppy. I am extremely disappointed and pissed that amazon would ollow 3rd party vendors to sell crap like this without verification of authenticity.
customer_reviews.author: clinton

customer_reviews.title: It's good, possibly not the best out there.
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews saying this is not mil spec, that's false, light house for the blind was in fact contracted by the government to produce these, they do have a NSN and they are legit. That being said there may be better ones out there. Four the price and about twenty minutes of sharpening I believe for the price this is a very good purchase. Very solid, and yes it can be set to 45° and 90°,apparently some reviewers never actually put in any effort.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived with outer coating already chipped off!!!! POOR QUALITY shovel.
customer_reviews.text: It came with bare metal exposed. The item arrived with the outer coating already chipping off. Not what I expect at this price. I would NOT have purchased this item have I known this. DO NOT BUY unless you want your shovel already looking like it's been used for 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jconn

customer_reviews.title: American shovel
customer_reviews.text: It’s the only one that matters. Everybody tries to copy it and fails. Miserably. If you see some $20 e-tool on Amazon and really believe it’s just the same as this, you’re in for a big disappointment. This is thick hardened steel. All metal construction. Heavy lock nut. Can be used as a shovel, pick, hammer, ax, fighting weapon and even a seat. Been around for 75 years for a reason. Made in the USA 🇺🇸. Yeah, it costs a little more. And it’s worth every damn penny. Highly recommend. Thanks for reading
customer_reviews.author: MooseTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Knockoff! Doesn't configure like original!
customer_reviews.text: Knockoff. Probably Chinese junk! Doesn't configure like original. Doesn't lock in grappling hook configuration. Doesn't sit flat in grill stove plate configuration - your food will slide into fire. Amazon needs to ban this company!
customer_reviews.author: Logan 5

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: I owned the WW2 version of this shovel as a mil-brat sixty years ago in post-war Germany. This shovel, trenching tool is built to be just as indestructible as the original was and still uses the same screw collar locking mechanism. Does what it’s designed to do...over and over and over again without complaining or failing. Well worth the money. They say imitation is the sincerest form of flattery. And there are myriad imitations of this shovel on the market. Do yourself a favor and get this one, the real deal, made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Felix D. Cat

customer_reviews.title: ... have a bonding "winter survival weekend" together and they loved it. Fit perfectly in their pack and worked ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for husband and son to have a bonding "winter survival weekend" together and they loved it. Fit perfectly in their pack and worked like a charm from what I was told. We had also bought a cover case for it that they both said work great too.
customer_reviews.author: Miki B

customer_reviews.title: Super tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great little shovel. Folds down neatly to fit under boat or truck seat. Very strong in all positions. Used it to dig under my little girl's playhouse for installing leveling blocks (granite stone) and for "cat holes" on the islands while out fishing the lake. A vast improvement over my generation's wooden handle entrenching tool.
customer_reviews.author: OldBollWeevil

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I wanted the same thing I had in the army because I know what I was getting. I didn't want to take a chance on another brand. And it is just like I drew it from CIF but without the layers of paint. It is brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Real deal
customer_reviews.text: I am one of the lucky people who received the real deal, with U.S. stamped on the side of the handle, thick/heavy metal. Additionaly purchased this $7 cover that fits very snug
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Nothing beats a good hole.
customer_reviews.text: Used but in good condition. It would not pass a layout inspection (dirt and rust are visible and it is clearly in need of a quick pass with a black can of spray paint) but it is in good enough condition to turn it into CIF when you are out processing. The carrier was brand new and that is a nice touch. The E-tool itself is highly durable and is solidly made. Something every camper should have handy and if you're a semi-serious backpacker this is something I carried on my ruck for nearly 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: JCrosby

customer_reviews.title: made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: very nice tool. well made in the USA. easy to deploy and stow. i previously had a different amazon shovel that was made in china, it was less expensive and flimsy, it sucked... gave it away. this one is solid! a nice addition for my Jeep. don't waste your money on the other knock-offs, get this one.
customer_reviews.author: slackerchef

customer_reviews.title: Top notch construction
customer_reviews.text: Solidly constructed tool. I have to say, it killed me to spend $60 for it, but once you get it, you know it will last! Looks amazing. I have yet to use it, but will report back once I do. The camo cover was optional at $10
customer_reviews.author: MJB9Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Digging to China
customer_reviews.text: I thought about buying a cheaper version of this but am glad I didn't. Other reviewers said this was worth the $ and they didn't lie. I've really worked with this and am not at all disappointed. It's stout & it's kind of ridiculous that I can dig so well with something so short! Have used for several home projects in tight spaces- plumbing, digging out under a caved in barn floor- and is very well suited for it. And if I need to dig a foxhole cuz of zombies I can- my dumb friends all say they're coming so I thought I'd give it a shout out. }: €
customer_reviews.author: Mouse in the house

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: Genuine e-tool. Works and does the job it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but top quality
customer_reviews.text: If it weren't for the price, I would give this five stars. Having said that, you get what you pay for and this seems to be the same E-tool issued to our troops. It folds compactly and extends into a sturdy spade. The blade can be locked down in either the shovel or hoe position and does not loosen up during use. I keep this in my 4x4 pickup truck for emergency use along with other odds and ends that bang around behind the seat. There are cheaper folding shovels but I don't think you will find better quality than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised real deal but very used
customer_reviews.text: Was advertised as used like new but came well used with dirt in the main hand screw and with a small crack around handle connection. Saved $10 getting used ‘not like new’. it is the real deal and not the cheap stuff so I hope it lasts. I may need to tack weld the crack. Knowing conditions I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pete B

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy a cheap trench tool. This went with my family on a weekend camp trip to a river sand bar. We dug a fire pit in no time and removed rocks when we prepped for the tent. An impressive test came when we needed to depart during low tide and our boat was solidly aground. My son removed so much sand under the bow that as soon as the stern floated, we were off. He moved at least two cubic yards of heavy, wet sand. I noted on the way home that there was almost no sign of wear on the tool anywhere. This is the one you want.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Solid and well built
customer_reviews.text: Solidly constructed with a good heft to the tool. What I received is NOT a cheap knock off that will bend or break under the slightest pressure. This is a solid, strong metal tool that has will stand up as well as my e-tool did when I was in the Army and I'm sure that I will be able to rely on this one just like I did my government issued one.
customer_reviews.author: Kriegs555

customer_reviews.title: cool shovel
customer_reviews.text: The shovel works well and is a little worn in but I like it, folds up well, I keep it under the back seat of my car in case I ever get stuck in the dirt or sand and have to dig my way out.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gear
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is rad. Every component on it is quality. I'm excited to get years of dirt flinging out of this very nice piece of kit. It was in the described condition. Would definitely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: PeterK

customer_reviews.title: Works good after some modifications.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for husband to use in his surveying job and he said it has some design flaws with regards to the screw down collar and riveting section. He made some adjustment to the rivets using an auger and put a washer on the screw down collar, now works great. So, guess it wasn't a complete bust if you have some know how to make some adjustment. Just not as strong as we had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: John W Evers

customer_reviews.title: Heaviest, solid, professional trench tool I could find.
customer_reviews.text: Give the pivot points a shot of gun lube and away you go. Heavy build. Excellent construction. I DID sharpen the teeth on the side of the blade a bit and it would make a saw/ax in second. Also makes it a real self defense item. This is not Chinese junk. Made in USA for military.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The 'tank' of shovels
customer_reviews.text: This tool is one tough customer and it's worth the cost. We use it as a shovel for back country travel around Washington. You will never feel like it's a "travel tool" or some substitute for a real shovel; it's every bit as tough as anything in your garage, and probably a lot tougher being steel throughout (minus the nut). We'll spend years beating this thing up and I suspect we won't ever need to replace it - and we do tend to wear things out.
customer_reviews.author: L. Munson

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to military issue. Light weight but not durable at all. I’ve had military issue last for 10+ years. This didn’t last one use before it began to bend and break. I would not spend $1 on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, without cluttering up your truck.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't needed to use it yet, hope I never do. But it's required for over-the-sand access to the beach, so had to have one. This one seems much sturdier than most of these things, and if fits in the pouch on the back of my 4runner seat.
customer_reviews.author: The Davinator

customer_reviews.title: Solid and hardcore
customer_reviews.text: So I am not sure what other have posted as far as this product being used, or rusty. Mine was just fine, looks like it might have been repainted, but I really don't care about flash, just function. This thing, once unfolded, is solid and seems like it will last forever. I got this for a family bug out pack. Seems a bit heavy with consideration to the contribution to the total pack weight; however, this will be my son's responsibility to hump this thing, but certainly not me! LOL get one
customer_reviews.author: hesty24

customer_reviews.title: Would have given it 5 stars. It came with ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it 5 stars. It came with directions on how to open it and lubricate it. Would have given it the 5th star if they would have lubricated it for me. Was only partially able to get the spade open. Need to go buy some wd40 n try opening it again after that. Came with a heavy duty case. Can't remember if the case was included in the description, or a pleasant surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa RN, PHN

customer_reviews.title: Shovel / Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, bought it to keep in my car for the winter time, but have taken it out camping as well. Fold up nicely and lock open firm. Dug a fire pit, and chopped down a small (4-6: dia.) dead tree for firewood all with the same tool. Easy enough to strip branched for kindling as well. The one side of the shovel may be a little sharp for digging out a car stuck in snow, but being able to lock in the shovel head at 90 degrees makes it work a lot better for pulling out snow.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the China made ones
customer_reviews.text: Can already tell that this is way better than the Made in China one I picked up years ago(for a trunk shovel and camping cat hole digger) and proceeded to demolish it in one use. Should have heeded the buy once, cry once motto on this item. It came with the older hard plastic case, which is nice, but not as nice as the newer MOLLE type ones. This one is all metal and has a great powder coating.
customer_reviews.author: BullNY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for multiple tasks.
customer_reviews.text: Can be configured for several tasks. Good size. Good balance. Seems very durable. Folds into a convenient size. Some may judge it as heavy for hiking. I wouldn't carry it on a long hike unless I knew I would use it repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: A Marine

customer_reviews.title: Bulletproof!
customer_reviews.text: BULLETPROOF!! This shovel is the real deal - tough as nails - I've used it to break down firewood for tinder and to break up into smaller pieces, etc. Have dug holes with it, sawed a tree limb once with the saw side (it's not meant to do much, but it will get through things if you give it enough time). The shovel is built like a tank and I had no worries beating on it.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. Sturdy metal shovel that should last a lifetime. Folds down small, is compact when folded up properly, and has a wide variety of uses, including that of an actual shovel. Ames True Temper stamped in the 1990s, so you know its legit. Tossed it into my bug out bag so I'm ready to go at a moments notice. A little pricey, but well worth the investment. You want something that is going to last you a while? Get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Spring

customer_reviews.title: Just be weary when buying used
customer_reviews.text: This was probably a good shovel once. But it looks like it sat in a garage for about 6 years collecting dust. It wasn’t even cleaned off when sold, which says a lot about the seller. I’ll be able to lube it up and it’ll be fine with some TLC, but this review is mainly for the owner. It’s a stout piece of metal, and it’s super heavy duty, so no doubt it’ll be a good survival shovel
customer_reviews.author: nathan livsey

customer_reviews.title: As expected.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be the same as the one issued which was the goal.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Ray

customer_reviews.title: Strong/Well Made and Just in Time for 2016 Blizzard
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected it to be. We have over an hour commute to the city and there is often a huge difference between snowfall in the winter between where we live and the city. I wanted something in case of an emergency that could really chop through some heavier stuff to clear tires. Well, the Blizzard of 2016 came and it performed well. Into icy chunks that plastic shovels would never have been able to get through. Got me out of a parking spot I was sealed into by a plow during the day. Might get another.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Thankyou for selling this shovel for such a low price.
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is perfect for the job I have to do. It's small and very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel jones

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: Genuine USGI issued shovel. Mine said Ames 90 which I assume means it was made in 1990. Brand new condition, no rust anywhere. Looks flawless. Going to sharpen the edges as they are not very sharp outta the box. The serrated part is more of gimmick its not sharp at all and I couldn't imagine trying to saw with it. Maybe once they are sharpened. Anyways I didn't buy it for that. The shovel is well built and a few ounces over 2lbs. Will come in handy when building a fire pit in the bush.
customer_reviews.author: Fed

customer_reviews.title: New issue; 20$
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for 20 bucks a pop; great to throw in car--backpack--camper and "forgetaboutit". The ones I received were from the vender "Defense-Acquisitions". Came new, unissued. Opened up, applied a little grease to threads, wiped with light oil and threw in truck. Great product at a great price. One of the ones I ordered had a little corrosion on the rivets--brushed off, oiled and threw in truck. I'd recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Am. Cust.

customer_reviews.title: Everyone loved how easy this thing folded up and stowed away
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we were going to the beach the next day. I figured why do we keep fighting with those silly plastic shovels, I want to make a BIG sand castle. Everyone loved how easy this thing folded up and stowed away. This shovel is built very well, I'm not sure if this is exactly like the ones issued to military personnel but it was built to last.
customer_reviews.author: CoffeeShopGuru

customer_reviews.title: Tough shovel.
customer_reviews.text: Compact and will be a great addition on the camping trip. It didn't come with a cover, but I picked one up at Army Surplus. I don't expect any problems with the shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great Shovel.... will last for years!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace two cheap Chinese manufactured ones that broke during a beach trip. This shovel is tough. It is exactly what I needed, it has dug sand and dirt on multiple camping trips. I keep it in my wrangler just in case I get stuck. This will last for years to come. Only complaint is that it is a little expensive, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Nice trenching tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought a "camping shovel" like my old army surplus trenching tool I lost. It was cheap bendable metal and did not last after digging one hole. I am glad I found this one on-line. It is built like my old surplus trenching tool, heavy duty construction and folds nicely into a compact size.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty. Folds to a compact size and does ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty. Folds to a compact size and does not take up much space, either in my truck or attached to my backpack. I was driving in a desert environment when we got stuck. Thankfully I had this stashed in the truck and in no time we dug ourselves out. You would be surprised how much you will use this if you have it with you.
customer_reviews.author: T.K.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty not cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, and seems like it will last for years. Easy enough to carry on a bug out bag.
customer_reviews.author: motomike69

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was taken back a little when I opened the package. I was HOPING for a good quality tool, but was not prepared for how impressive this tool is. It will make you want to run outside and dig a hole. I bought the ACU camo pouch for this and it matches my Source pack nicely.
customer_reviews.author: tazmaniac

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for digging your car out of the snow when a snowplow seals you in.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Got to love these tools. I'll take it over a bayonet anyday!
customer_reviews.text: I got a used AMES (knew it was used). Looks like she has a lot of life left in her and they even gave it a quick paint job before sending it off. Thanks guys!
customer_reviews.author: T Wolf

customer_reviews.title: This is the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: True G.I. entrenching tool. Came brand new. Edge is sharp. Folds out and locks in place easily. Identical to the one I was issued in the military. Definitely would recommend. It also came with the old school heavy plastic cover with Alice Clips, which I wasn't expecting. I already purchased a Molle canvas cover for it, but if you want to save some money, just know that this one comes with a cover that will function.
customer_reviews.author: DakotaBuilt

customer_reviews.title: Seems legit
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be the real deal. I received the Ames made version, and I'm happy about that. Once I get it out camping and what not, I'll update the review, but at least it's what was advertised.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mariner

customer_reviews.title: easily thrown into the bag of a car or camping ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: small, compact, well made, easily thrown into the bag of a car or camping bag for winters or general digging Cons: has a bit of a tendency to fold in on itself. Part of the cost for saving space Good enough for the military, good enough for me
customer_reviews.author: Melissa White

customer_reviews.title: US GI Military OI E-Tool Entrenching Shovel...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for emergencies in the winter/off-road, looks to be solidly built...
customer_reviews.author: Raa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality shovel
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected from an entrenching tool. Good quality. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Multi-Tool Taskinator

customer_reviews.title: No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my E Tool from the issued one given. Both are the same and shipping cam faster than listed. The one pictured is exactly what you will receive, not some half hanging item.
customer_reviews.author: GOAT @ REVIEWS

customer_reviews.title: Just like my US Army one
customer_reviews.text: Just like my US Army one. Everybody needs one in their survival kit in their truck or car. High center on snow. Here's your answer. No ends to its uses.
customer_reviews.author: Woodrow01

customer_reviews.title: Hefty and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my husband on deployment (he lost his). Just like everyone else’s! Hefty and durable. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jaci Brandl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for metal detecting and I couldn't be happier. It's rugged and a perfect width to dig my plugs. Plus it's compact to fit in a small pack. Yes it is heavy but in order for it to be durable, it has to be well built which it proved to be. Sometimes my target is over a foot deep and crowded with roots. This shovel has made it so I spend less time retrieving and more time hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: ... on my pack or even on my belt highly recommended great
customer_reviews.text: was looking for a strong dependable compact shovel and this one fits that profile very well just had touch up the edges a bit to make them a little sharper but not necessary and also bought the e tool molle carrier pouch for it now it fits snug on my pack or even on my belt highly recommended great buy
customer_reviews.author: jose dominguez

customer_reviews.title: 🇺🇸
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. If you want a shovel then this is the one you need to have. It is very nice and heavy, I love It.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: A durable and reasonably priced shovel when you need something small.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use when my wife and I go camping. It works great for that. I know it's durable because I used the same thing in the Army for many years. I thought about picking up a used one at a surplus shop but they wanted almost as much for a used one so I went ahead and ordered a new one from Amazon. I expect it to last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Genuine US Miliyaty Etool
customer_reviews.text: Bought it with the suggested GI military MOLLE II entrenching tool cover. Perfect fit. Excellent tool, durable, genuine US military e tool. Folds up into a nice neat triangle. Perfect for a day at the beach or to carry in a backpack or bug out bag
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great compact shovel. Good quality. Fits neatly out of the way in spare tire comportment of my SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in VA

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is worth every penny. It has been very useful in many situations. From camping to backyard tasks, this shovel is reliable, strong, and built to last. The folding function is great and still works flawlessly after two years of heavy use. The carrying case is high quality, hard, thick molded plastic and will stand up to the test of time. This product will stand up to the test of time and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great design and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This item is just as sturdy as other reviewers have said. It will hold up to a lot of abuse. I took it to the beach and some of the black paint wore off while digging. I also noticed a bit if rust forming after rinsing and letting air dry around the serrated edge. It doesn't bother me though so 5 stars it is!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Not a perfect shovel, but high quality
customer_reviews.text: A true USGI entrenching tool. Not a perfect shovel, but high quality, portable tool for digging.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L.

customer_reviews.title: The best military shovel design in the world.
customer_reviews.text: The same shovel that has been issued since the end of the Vietnam War. If it had any real flaws in it, we would have found them by now. This shovel has been used as an axe, grappling hook, lever/fulcrum, booby trap, persuader, you name it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott T.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality metal and sturdy handle
customer_reviews.text: Legitimate GI E-Tool that is Made in USA by Ames True Temper. Very good quality metal and sturdy handle. The joints and nut may be pretty stiff when you get the tool, but when you add oil it works great. Forget those cheap foreign e-tools! They are junk! This is the real deal. Don;t forget your e-tool pouch.
customer_reviews.author: ninja_hamster

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: These are great I put one in each car. They are a shovel, a pick, could chop down a tree if needed. Very well built and worth every cent. These make the cheap imitations look like toys. This a tool, you can actually dig a hole with it. Built like a tank. Buy one much better than the Gerber gorge shovel and made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Fun

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition. So new that it is extremely tight to unfold and refold. My boyfriend loves it so much, and used it the day he got it. He says it chops logs better than his axe! Great gift for anybody who is into survival things or just helpful tools in general!
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. I carry it in my car as an "everything tool". To dig myself out of snow, to open up the ground while out camping or bbq-ing, or to brake something. It is also great for self-defense should the need ever arise. Built for the Army, what more can I say.
customer_reviews.author: KP ESQ.

customer_reviews.title: Authentic GI item
customer_reviews.text: Just as described, a military issue item, not some knock off garbage. Item looks new or at a minimum rebuilt to new.
customer_reviews.author: Space and Time, KY

customer_reviews.title: Dig With Confidence
customer_reviews.text: Much higher quality than a folding camping shovel. If you bother to carry a shovel when camping - get this one. Does what it's suppose to do and does not break or bend. If you've ever had one of those cheap camping shovels bend when you really needed it you'll appreciate this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Beast
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very solidly constructed, and I love it. Its tough to find well made stuff these days, there is a lot of form over function, this has both. From a tight, compact form it unfolds into a solid if small shovel. Its not exactly as good as a full size shovel, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy shovel
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to test it out yet, but the shovel feels very solid. After some manhandling, I figured out how to close it. Will be a great advantage when travelling through the woods this summer. Shipped quickly and arrived in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: nic b

customer_reviews.title: I received a legit e tool
customer_reviews.text: Some people received a knockoff. I received a legit e tool. It’s good but I will also recommend the cold steel spetsnaz shovel. That thing is savage
customer_reviews.author: jarad k howard

customer_reviews.title: Study, well-built
customer_reviews.text: I’m impressed with the sturdiness. Seems like it should hold up well to use.
customer_reviews.author: Spare Things 410

customer_reviews.title: Bargin Tool
customer_reviews.text: The day it arrived I took it out and tested it... For the money youre not gomna find a better camp shovel. Its sturdy and made of heavier gauge steel than many I've seen. Its lack of a sheath was not an issue as I was able to pick one up at an Army surplus store for less than 5.00 (cheaper than the cost of buying online with the cost of shipping.)
customer_reviews.author: Marsha C. Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Tough tool.
customer_reviews.text: If you want the best, toughest folding shovel, get this.
customer_reviews.author: Wackezoid

customer_reviews.title: Classic!
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed for my camper van. It folds very small and comes with a great little case. I like to dig a small trench around the perimeter of my campsite whenever it's going to rain. Keeps everything on the ground from flooding!
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Official issue e-tool, not a knockoff
customer_reviews.text: This e-tool is the real deal used by our troops. It came with the green case as well. I couldn't be happier with this tool, it will stay in my truck box so I will always have it when I need it. Solid made product, will take this over any of the other e-tools out there.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Joe

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty folding shovel.  approx 3lbs
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a folding shovel. Very heavy duty. Its hard too imagine a better one. Unless of course it was much lighter and just as strong. Now that would be a perfect folding shovel!
customer_reviews.author: grew up in the 1960s

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This wonderful device is exactly what I expected it to be. Many of the 1 star reviews will say that it's a cheap imitation due to the fact that an Army E02 folding shovel is supposed to be sharp as an axe....That being said, don't listen to them. The product is supposed to ship with a dull blade by law and local hardware store should be able to sharpen it for you.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your gear
customer_reviews.text: American made and great quality. A couple drops of Lucas on the hinges and threads and she's smooth as can be.
customer_reviews.author: actium31

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Built Like a Tank
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and great to have on hand at camp. Folds down very compact and built like a tank. I got a multicam pouch for it and it's a good combo for carrying around.
customer_reviews.author: A. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Dig a hole or bash a zombie...
customer_reviews.text: What more can be said about this tool. Compact, 1000 uses, something everyone should keep in their trunk. Cheap insurance for snow, mud or that brain eating zombie. Mine is old stock GI issue just like back in the day. Built to last, just spray it off and toss in the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGilmore

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought the cheaper ones, this one is heavier but it is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: ... as of today but it appears to be very sturdy and made of quality steel
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this as of today but it appears to be very sturdy and made of quality steel.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: E-tool, just like dad used
customer_reviews.text: This is a standard military E-tool, not a knockoff. Yes, there are knockoffs, none have matched up to the simple durability, reliability, and functionality of the original. Whatever the cost is, this will be worth more than anything similar that you can buy for less or equal cost.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: A well-built survival tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy tool to have in an earthquake area. It had very minor oxidation around the joints, but a light coat of oil eliminated any trace, and made the shovel easier to unfold. I was hoping that the serrated edge was a bit sharper. All in all I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: umpire2220

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I love this this it is what I wanted for my bug out bag it is heavy duty and when you open it there is a round coupling at the bottom that you turn and it locks the whole thing from folding so you can use it. pretty cool !!!
customer_reviews.author: JOKER

customer_reviews.title: Great E-Tool.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived as described by seller, purchased this item as a replacement to go on my Military Molle backpack. Item is great, just like the one I was issued in boot camp. 5*****
customer_reviews.author: Eric F. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shovel primarily to keep in my car in case of emergencies, but because it folds up to be so compact, I often carry it in my pack during hikes. It is very sturdy and although the tightening collar is plastic, the rest of the shovel, including all of the hinges, are made of metal. It's not fancy by any means, but it's a great simple product that beats most of the brand-name collapsible shovels in terms of price.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: AWE-fricken-SOME!
customer_reviews.text: This thing rules. Hardcore, small enough for a backpack and would probably be a great weapon against bigfoot if he ever tried getting into your shizzy while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Wiggum

customer_reviews.title: E-tool
customer_reviews.text: Just like the one Uncle Sam issued me but new and without all the rust. I'm not quite sure why this didn't come with the cover but I was able to find that for under $10. This is part of my bug-out kit and stays in my Jeep. Great tool
customer_reviews.author: Robert Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Said it's the best shovel he's ever owned
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES this shovel! Said it's the best shovel he's ever owned. Incredible quality & versatility. Cuts thru the dirt easily. Worth the money & more!
customer_reviews.author: SBM

customer_reviews.title: A great tool that will come in handy when you need it.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet. But, I took a very close look at if and it appears to be well made. It folds up very nicely and all of the joints (welds and bolts), appear to be strong.
customer_reviews.author: 3rdGen

customer_reviews.title: perfect garden tool
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional gardener and I use this tool constantly. Great for planting small and medium shrubs. If you fold halfway it makes a great short hoe or pick for moving dirt piles, packing dirt and hacking roots. Ames tru-temper(the manufacturer) is of the highest quality. This is a rock solid professional grade tool that should last a lifetime. BTW, it is different than the picture above, and it comes with a high quality flexible case that has ALICE(MOLLE?) clips attached.
customer_reviews.author: nowuz

product_meta.title: US GI Military Original Issue E-Tool Entrenching Shovel
product_meta.description: GENUINE U.S. MILITARY ISSUE Made for the US Military with Superior Materials and Workmanship. It is durable and last a life time. You will have a shovel that won't fall apart or break during heavy work use. Steel Blade with Aluminum Handle. Can be used as a saw, axe, mattock, or shovel. Folds to 9", extends to 24". Threaded handle locks blade into 2 positions. Genuine US Military Issue, Never used US Surplus. NSN 5120008785932
feature_bullets: Tri-fold Design Collapses for Easy Carry/Storage
Sharpened Axe Edge, Serrated Saw Edge
